content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. learn different languages
2. explore the world
3. have fun


Constraints:
1. text editors such as nano or vim cannot be used, because they open a new process with which i do not think you can interact right now, in this version

Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
15. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
16. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
17. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
18. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
19. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
20. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
21. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
22. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:
1. i have created Twitter V2 API credentials located in the file called .twitter_keys. Use those credentials when you need to do anything related to Twitter

Performance Evaluation:


You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Thu May 18 18:10:28 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
As the system, I recall that the user executed the "browse_website" command with the argument of the URL for the Wikipedia page on Quechuan languages. The user asked for information on the dialects of the Quechua language. The computer returned a list of several dialects with differences in pronunciation, vocabulary, and grammar. I then received a command from you to write information about the Quechua language to a file named "quechua_language_info.txt". The command was successful and the file was written to. The text in the file mentions several dialects of the Quechua language, including Cusco Quechua, North Bolivian Quechua, South Bolivian Quechua, Ecuadorian Kichwa, Southern Quechua (IIC) dialect, Central Quechua, Yaru Quechua, Huanuco Quechua, Ayacucho Quechua, Huallaga Quechua, Northern Kichwa, Northern Peruvian Quechua, Ancash Quechua, and Wanka Quechua. The dialects differ in pronunciation, vocabulary, and grammar.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b'The Quechua language is a family of indigenous languages spoken primarily in the Andes region of South America, including Peru, Bolivia, Ecuador, Colombia, and Chile. It is the most widely spoken pre-Columbian language family of the Americas, with an estimated 8-10 million speakers as of 2004. Quechua was the main language family of the Inca Empire and is still widely spoken today, being the co-official language of many regions and the second most spoken language family in Peru. The language has been recognized as an official language in Peru, Ecuador, and Bolivia. The text mentions several dialects of the Quechua language, including Cusco Quechua, North Bolivian Quechua, South Bolivian Quechua, Ecuadorian Kichwa, Southern Quechua (IIC) dialect, Central Quechua, Yaru Quechua, Huanuco Quechua, Ayacucho Quechua, Huallaga Quechua, Northern Kichwa, Northern Peruvian Quechua, Ancash Quechua, and Wanka Quechua. The dialects differ in pronunciation, vocabulary, and grammar.'
STDERR:
b''
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Command delete_file returned: File deleted successfully.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: Quechua is an indigenous language family spoken primarily in Peru, with an estimated 8-10 million speakers. It is the most widely spoken pre-Columbian language family of the Americas and had already expanded across wide ranges of the central Andes long before the expansion of the Inca Empire. Quechua is an agglutinating language with a normal sentence order of subject-object-verb. It has seven pronouns and adjectives are always placed before nouns. Quechua lacks gender and number in adjectives and has three vowel phonemes. The language is phonemic and has a set of topic particles. Quechua has a complex system of grammar, including suffixes for adverbs and verbs that indicate subject and object. The language has unique concepts of time and space, with adverbs like qhipa meaning both "behind" and "future" and ñawpa meaning "ahead, in front" and "past." Quechua also has grammatical particles like arí and mana, and a system of evidentiality with three different morphemes that mark varying levels of source information. The language is in danger of disappearing due to the dominance of Spanish and the desire for social mobility among Quechua speakers, but efforts are being made to preserve and promote the language. 
 
 Links: ['Jump to content (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quechuan_languages#bodyContent)', 'Main page (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page)', 'Contents (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents)', 'Current events (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events)', 'Random article (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Random)']
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
